intro: Scleranthus hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker's knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is adapted to temperate climates. Its leaves are usually linear to lanceolate, and the flowers are pink to purple in color, appearing in late spring to early summer. Scleranthus hohenackeri plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and distribution.
